Author: CrisF#3405
Content: For the anonymous vote chain do you think a 0 block reward, privately mined chain that only gives voters 1 coin and enough for fees to make 2 txs would work?

Content:
so, a blockchain to conduct a private vote is needed
it just need to give the result
correct?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
How can a Zero-Knowledge Vote be made using the Labs voting mechanisn?

(By Zero-Knowledge Vote I mean a vote that can be made once per issue, and only once per issue, by a private 'voting' key that belongs to a set of 'voting' keys (eg, Notary keys).  The vote would provably belong to the set of keys, but unknown as to which key it came from.) @gcharang

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
jl777 originally suggested ```you could send 1.0002 coins to each taddr. then each voter would do a t -> z to a tmp address and from there a z->z to the voting address
assuming everybody votes, it seems to work, but if some dont vote it could be an issue```

Content:

Author: CrisF#3405

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: @CrisF my idea was more about protecting the identity of the voter than to hide the voting process itself and its results from the external eyes. So in my case there is probably no need for using z-addresses to vote, there would be a need of z-addresses for the main coins. What do you think?

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: So if someone wants to submits a proposal he'd need to pay the creation of one-time voting tokens+ necessary tx fees and then the z-addresse's owners should be enabled somehow to claim their voting tokens 1 for each main coin they are owning.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content:
Hi @johnwhitestar ,
In my case I want the same as you.  I want the process to be verifiable.  The z-tx is used to anonymize what the voter votes for.

- Voters are known (pubkey).  

- They are sent 1 coin + tx fees (enough for 2 transactions) each T-address

- They send the coin to a Z-address

- From the Z-address to the address that they vote for

One coin in the vote address coins as a vote.  

This needs to be modified with the new info from above.

Author: phm87#7395
Content: from my understanding, I agree that if 100% of blocks are mined by private miners (and not 75% of blocks as on KMD) and that trusted entities controls the miners'keys, I think that the txfee will be mandatory

Author: phm87#7395
Content: but voters can still sell their vote with the old method where you agree to vote for someone (whatever the reason) then you vote for him. We won't be able to forbid social engineering prior to election

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: we can't forbid social engineering in any election though?

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: I guess that is as as goods a result as can be expected.

Content: cant you just use a faucet like thing that gives out a vote... I guess its not possible then to stop people voting twice though... I think this is the main issue.

Content: I think i know what you mean, have X votes, for X people then send 1 to each registered address, that is then sent T->Z then to the vote address's/CC that does it. Vote CC is something I wanted to make for a while, but havent got there yet.

Content: That's my want, but I think @johnwhitestar is after something different.

Content: I feel like you @CrisF

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: My idea is that if I have X coins I have X votes.

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: So it doesn't matter how many identities I have.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Well, if that 's the case it should be possible.

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: Of course I can't send voting coins to an address if I don't know how much coins are on what address, but I know how many was issued by blockchain so far, so I can issue voting coins and ask people interested to vote to claim them.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Yes but how to you prevent one person caliming more than one?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or is that not a problem?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: by doing a T->Z->T you should anoynmise all the votes, as long as they are all done at the same time, like jumblr does.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: My usecase is for an anon NN vote.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so you could bverify the identity off chain and distrubute the coins, then have them all jumbled at some defined time after that. Shouldnt be that hard to do really.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Doestn even really need a CC, unless you dont want ot make a new vote chain each time.

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Yeah, that's why I was asking about JUMBLR.  gcharang said it would have to beimplemented it in the source code thought

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, this wil need source changes.

Content: @blackjok3r verifying offchain would be against voters anonymity.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I dont see another way to do it using current tech we have really.. For something like NN vote, its qute easy as each key is known. But any thing else is more difficult.

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: I see....

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: like if you dont care if people get more than 1 vote, then its no problem..

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: no I care of course

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: if the only thing that you care about is X votes are used to vote for Y/Z then its easy. But how to you protect anoyn and also prevent sybil attack?

Author: johnwhitestar#1227
Content: I was thinking, I don't know what address keeps what coins, but the blockchain knows...

Content: So in the claiming process it verifies whether the claimer has the coins he is claiming for.

Content: yes, but you some how need to know that you sent the votes only 1 to each person, but you cant ID them? So how is that possible, blockchain is great to track the votes after they have been distributed.

Content: ü§î
